glsa.title: R: Arbitrary Code Execution
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in R, which can lead to arbitrary code execution.

background.p: R is a language and environment for statistical computing and graphics.

description.p: Deserialization of untrusted data can occur in the R statistical programming language, enabling a maliciously crafted RDS (R Data Serialization) formatted file or R package to run arbitrary code on an end userâ€™s system when interacted with.

impact.p: Arbitrary code may be run when deserializing untrusted data.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All R users should upgrade to the latest version:
